remarks: If the right-hand side of a 'less than' relationship is an addition, then we can express the left-hand side as an addition, too, where each term is respectively less than each term of the original right side. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 15-Mar-2017.)
statement:
lt2addrd.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR ) $.
lt2addrd.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
lt2addrd.3 $e |- ( ph -> C e. RR ) $.
lt2addrd.4 $e |- ( ph -> A < ( B + C ) ) $.
lt2addrd $p |- ( ph -> E. b e. RR E. c e. RR ( A = ( b + c ) /\ b < B /\ c < C ) ) $.
$d A b c $.
$d B b c $.
$d C b c $.
